I'm not familiar with crossmark wallet.
https://www.xrptoolkit.com/connect-wallet
XRP Toolkit lists the following compatible wallets on its site:
>Bitfrost Wallet
>Ledger Device
>Xaman Wallet
>D'Cent Wallet
>Keystone
>Cobo Vault

Beside those, it also gives the option to enter an address, with this note:
>View your account or prepare transactions to be signed by another account, for example an account set as regular key.
Based on the wording here, it doesn't sound like you'd be able to actually sign transactions this way.
Read only basically; unless I'm misunderstanding the wording here.

If you want to connect and interact with XRP Toolkit, then you'll need to limit yourself to the above listed choices.

Good one

Sent from my iPod

On Sep 1,2011, at 10:16 AM wrote:

From: Clay Dunnagan
Sent: Wednesday, August 31, 2011 10:39 PM
Subject: The Silver Screw

THE SILVER SCREW

Once upon a time, a young lad was born without a belly button. In its place was a silver screw. All the doctors told his mother that there was nothing they could do.

Like it or not, he was stuck with it . . . He was screwed.

All the years of growing up were real tough on him, as all who saw the screw made fun of him. He avoided leaving his house . . . And thus, never made any friends.

One day, a mysterious stranger saw his belly and told him of a monk in Tibet who could get rid of the screw for him. He was thrilled. The next day, he took all of his life's savings and bought a ticket to Nepal .

After several days of climbing up steep cliffs, he came upon a giant monastery. The monk knew exactly why he had come. The screwy guy was told to sleep in the highest tower of the monastery and the following day when he awoke, the screw would have been removed. The man immediately went to the room and fell asleep.

During the night while he slept, a purple fog floated in an open window. In the mist floated a solid silver screwdriver. In just moments, the screwdriver removed the screw and disappeared out the window.

The next morning when the man awoke, he saw the silver screw laying on the pillow next to him. Reaching down, he felt his navel, and there was no screw there! Jubilant, he leaped out of bed . . . And his ass fell off.

The moral to this is:

'Don't screw around with things you don't understand -- You could lose your ass.'

Sent from my iPhone

61857035
>>61857010
>In 1980 people in offices just ditched paper and started using computers.

That is your assumption based on how we work today, but that isn't how people worked in the past. It took teams of people called 'computers' to do all the math by hand. I don't even want to imagine what doing bi-weekly payroll was like for a large company. They would have seen rapid technological progress displace people who thought they would be doing math by hand forever, first with digital calculators which would have easily halved headcounts and then with computers which probably halved it even further. Now we have ERP software that lets a handful of people do payroll for a large company with thousands of employees.

It would have looked like the end of the world for people doing menial office jobs.

Everything doubled in price from 2016 to 2023, if you followed the chart then your net worth would've been cut in half.

This goes to show you just how dumb and disingenuous the silly shillies are. You can ask Goldberg whatever the hell you want but he is not obligated to give you a truthful answer when M&A is involved. He wouldn't tell you so this is completely useless.
This still does not solve the CUSIP Conundrum. Words only get you so far, but right here right now in 2026 there are open Bed Bath and Beyond stores and the company that operates them is not even using the Overstock/BYON/BBBY CUSIP. They issued new securities in October using BBBYQs CUSIP.
It's already proven 100% fact that a reverse merger of the BBBYQ shell has already occurred with BBBY. There is zero counterargument.
Overstock, BYON and BBBY all kept them same CUSIP. So why now does it suddenly switch? Occams Razor solves the puzzle: BBBYQ shell reverse merger has already occured and the details are not in any known docket.
BBBY mystery has been solved by yours truly.
